places.name: Eco Park

reviews.text:
Wow, Eco Park in Kolkata is such a gem! üåø Tucked away in New Town, this massive 480-acre park is my go-to for a fun, chill day out. It's got everything-gorgeous lakes, vibrant gardens, and even mini Seven Wonders to snap pics with (just INR 30 to see ‚Äòem)! üö§ Boating's a blast (INR 50‚Äì300), and I love renting a cycle (INR 70‚Äì150) to zip around. The musical fountain at night? Total magic! üåü

It's super family-friendly, though I wish there were more kid facilities. Everyone from toddlers to grandparents can enjoy it, but it's not the best for wheelchairs. The park's pretty eco-conscious with solar lights and recycling, but those plastic food stall cups bug me. ‚ôªÔ∏è Entry's only INR 30 (kids INR 15), and most activities are dirt cheap. Go early to dodge the weekend crowds! Pack water, sunscreen, and maybe a picnic-Eco Park's perfect for making memories! üòÑ

Eco Park is truly a breath of fresh air in the heart of Kolkata. Spread across a vast area, it offers something for everyone-beautiful gardens, themed zones, a large lake, and plenty of open space to relax or take a long walk. The landscaping is well-maintained and the variety of attractions, like the replicas of the Seven Wonders and boating on the lake, make it an ideal spot for both families and solo visitors. I especially enjoyed the peaceful vibe away from the city's hustle. It's a great place to unwind, click pictures, or just spend time close to nature. Clean, spacious, and thoughtfully designed-definitely worth a visit!

A Good place for a family day out. Entry fees is Rs 30 and you just can enjoy the sprawling park spread over huge acerages. For seven wonders you can get a entry for Rs 30. Also a huge rain forests area can be ur attraction. Mist garden is another attraction. Boating specially during evening is attractive after lights come out. Island and solar done is added attraction. But need to have patience for walking.

places.generalDescription: The Howrah Bridge, also known as Rabindra Setu, is a bustling cantilever road bridge that spans the Hooghly River, connecting Kolkata and Howrah in Bengal. Built by the British and opened in 1943, it is one of the busiest bridges in India. Despite its age, it is referred to as the 'New Howrah Bridge' and stands as an enduring symbol of Kolkata.

sources.snippet: This one tops the list of places to see in Kolkata, probably because it gets so often portrayed in movies. reviews.text:
One of the most iconic landmarks of India!
Howrah Bridge is not just a bridge - it's a symbol of Kolkata's vibrant culture and daily life. The view of the Hooghly River from here is breathtaking, especially during sunrise or sunset. You'll see thousands of people crossing it every day - from local vendors to daily commuters.

It's a perfect blend of engineering marvel and historic charm. A must-visit if you're in Kolkata!

üïô Best time to visit: Early morning or evening
üìçPro tip: Walk across the bridge for a real feel of Kolkata's heartbeat

The bridge is a landmark, and it looks absolutely majestic.

A bridge of this size to standing still without any support pillars makes it an engineering marvel.

I just wish it was cleaner. But Kolkata as a city is very dirty itself, so it's not really fair to expect that the bridge will be an exception.
An iconic landmark of Kolkata, Howrah Bridge is a stunning example of engineering and history. Best experienced at sunrise or night when it's beautifully lit. A must-see symbol of the city.

places.name: Eden Gardens

reviews.text: Eden Gardens is the only Venue for International Cricket matches and IPL matches in Kolkata, West Bengal. It is always a treat to watch a Cricket match in Eden Gardens Cricket Stadium. It is managed by Cricket Association of Bengal( CAB). One of the ancient and nostalgic cricket stadiums in India. This stadium is famous for the enthusiasm of the Cricket Lovers and fans. The atmosphere is always electric as it remains forever...

Eden Gardens in Kolkata is a place every cricket fan dreams of visiting. Known as the ‚ÄúMecca of Indian cricket,‚Äù this iconic stadium can hold over 60,000 people, and the energy here is simply electrifying during a live match. The roar of the crowd, the sight of cricketing legends on the field, and the sheer scale of the arena make it unforgettable. Even if you are not a huge cricket follower, stepping inside gives you goosebumps because of its history and atmosphere. Outside the stadium, the Eden Gardens park offers a calm contrast, with shady trees and a small lake perfect for a quiet walk. A visit here blends passion, history, and the thrill of being part of something larger than life.

If cricket had a Heaven in India, then Eden Gardens would be it. This isn't just a stadium - it's an emotion, a coliseum where legends are made, dreams are shattered, and 66,000+ voices chant in unison, shaking the very ground. Established in 1864, Eden Gardens is India's oldest and second-largest cricket stadium, often called the ‚ÄúLords of the East‚Äù (but let's be honest, even Lord's can't match the madness of an India-Pakistan match here!).
The roar of the crowd when Sourav Ganguly waved his shirt at Lord's? That energy was born here. Sachin's records, Dhoni's helicopter shots, and Kolkata Knight Riders' IPL triumphs? All celebrated under Eden's floodlights.
But Eden Gardens isn't just about cricket. The Maidan surrounding it is Kolkata's green lung, where footballers, morning walkers, and political rallies coexist in perfect chaos. Nearby, the Rabindra Sadan-Nandan cultural complex fuels Bengal's love for theatre and films, while the Mohan Bagan, Mohammedan Sporting and East Bengal football clubs remind you that Kolkata's second religion is football.
And then there's the Eden Gardens Park, a serene escape with a picturesque lake, along with the pagoda, perfect for a quiet evening stroll (assuming you aren't still hoarse from screaming at a match).
Verdict: Whether you love cricket or just the thrill of history, Eden Gardens is a must-visit.
Pro tip - Catch a live match here; the energy is electric, and the crowd could out-cheer a rock concert!

places.name: Indian Museum

reviews.text:
The Indian Museum is a must-visit destination for history lovers and culture enthusiasts. It houses an incredible collection of artifacts from ancient times, including sculptures, fossils, coins, textiles, and more. The Egyptian mummy and the grand Buddhist galleries are particularly fascinating.

The museum is quite large, so give yourself at least 2‚Äì3 hours to explore it properly. It can get a little warm inside during summer months, so I recommend visiting in winter for a more comfortable experience. Overall, it's an enriching and educational experience that offers a glimpse into India's vast and diverse heritage.

I love exploring museums and have visited museums across all major Indian cities, and I can say with confidence that this is the finest museum in India, at least from my experience. The collection is vast and incredibly diverse, showcasing historic items and antiques from across time and geography. The star attraction is the 4000 year old Egyptian mummy in the Egypt Gallery, which is truly fascinating. Apart from that, the museum also houses remarkable Buddhist archaeological treasures from Gandhara (present-day Kandahar, Afghanistan), along with fascinating galleries on fossils, zoology, birds, geology and what not. The Botany Survey of India is also part of this museum, adding to its richness and diversity. I would recommend keeping at least 2‚Äì3 hours aside to explore properly. This museum is a journey through both history and culture, and an absolute must visit.

Visiting the Indian Museum was an enlightening and enjoyable experience!

Every gallery tells a unique story, and I learned so much, especially in the Zoological and Egyptian sections, which were my favorites-truly captivating!

The museum is a paradise for history buffs and curious travelers, offering a deep dive into India's rich heritage and beyond.

The museum is conveniently located near Park Street Metro, making it super accessible.

However, the ticket prices are a bit steep for college students, and there are extra charges for mobile phone photography.

The cafeteria prices, though, are quite reasonable.

I highly recommend taking your time to explore this inspiring and educational gem.

Had a great time with my buddies!

It's a journey through time that's well worth taking, imperfections and all.

places.generalDescription: Victoria Memorial is an exquisite white marble museum in Kolkata, built in 1921 as a tribute to Queen Victoria. sources.snippet: Commissioned by Lord Curzon, the then Viceroy of India, this vast white marble palace was designed to commemorate Queen Victoria‚Äôs demise in 1901. places.name: Jorasanko Thakurbari

reviews.text:
Jorasanko Thakur Bari, located in North Kolkata, is the ancestral home of the renowned Tagore family. Built in 1784-85 by Nilmoni Tagore, the house has a rich history and cultural significance. Here's a brief overview:

History
- The land was donated by the Sett family of Burrabazar to Prince Dwarkanath Tagore, Rabindranath Tagore's grandfather.
- The house was expanded by Prince Dwarkanath Tagore and became the residence of the Tagore family.
- Rabindranath Tagore, the first Asian Nobel laureate, was born here in 1861 and spent most of his life in this house.

Architecture and Layout
- The mansion showcases traditional Bengali architecture with a sprawling 35,000 square meter area.
- It features a rounded verandah, allowing family members to watch performances on the natya manch.
- The house has multiple wings, including the Bhdrashan Bari (Maharshi Bhavan) and the Boithak Khana Bari.

Rabindra Bharati University and Museum
- The Government of West Bengal established Rabindra Bharati University in 1961 to commemorate Rabindranath Tagore's birth centenary.
- The university focuses on Indian classical fine arts and quality education.
- The Rabindra Bharati Museum, located within the complex, showcases the history of the Tagore family, their involvement in the Bengal Renaissance, and Brahmo Samaj.
- The museum features over 700 paintings, manuscripts, books, and antique items, including Rabindranath Tagore's original paintings and self-composed wedding invitation card ¬π ¬≤.

Visitor Information
- *Timings:* 10:30 AM - 5:00 PM (closed on Mondays)
- *Entry Fee:* Indians: ‚Çπ20 (adults), ‚Çπ10 (students); Foreigners: ‚Çπ150 (adults), ‚Çπ100 (students)
- *Light and Sound Show:* ‚Çπ50 per person, available in Bengali and English
¬≤ ¬≥

Overall, Jorasanko Thakur Bari is a significant cultural and historical landmark in Kolkata, offering insights into the life and works of Rabindranath Tagore and the Tagore family.

A very peaceful and culturally rich place. Walking through the ancestral home of Rabindranath Tagore feels like stepping back in time. The atmosphere is calm, and the museum gives a beautiful glimpse into the life and legacy of the Tagore family. Highly recommended for anyone interested in history, literature, or just looking for a quiet escape in the heart of the city.

It requires a ticket for entry and a different one to take pictures only from the outside. No inside photography is not allowed. This establishment formulated with many buildings including the living room of Rabindranath Tagore. His daily used things are being displayed here and with his car too. Walking through corridor of the main museum building one could have perception about the lifestyle and type of that time.

**Cleanliness & Hygiene**:

**Value for Money**:

**Overall Experience**:
Ozora provides a unique dining experience with stunning views but mixed service and drink quality. It's worth visiting for special occasions, but experiences may vary.

places.generalDescription: St. Paul's Cathedral is a significant Anglican church in Kolkata, completed in 1847. It boasts a restored steeple and remarkable stained glass windows. The cathedral stands as an impressive example of colonial architecture alongside the old Writers Building and the Victoria Memorial. Built to accommodate the growing European community, it resembles England's Norwich Cathedral with its pointed arches, buttresses, and vertical piers. St. Paul's Cathedral replaced St.

places.name: St. Paul's Cathedral

reviews.text:
St. Paul's Cathedral is a must-visit for those who appreciate history, architecture and tranquility. With an entry fee of ‚Çπ10, this iconic church offers a peaceful and serene atmosphere that makes you feel instantly at ease.

The Gothic-style architecture is truly stunning with high ceilings, intricate stained-glass windows, and beautifully designed interiors. While photography is not allowed inside, the experience of just sitting there in silence, soaking in the calmness is worth it.

Whether you're visiting for prayer, history or just some quiet time, St. Paul's Cathedral is a perfect escape from the city's hustle. Highly recommended for a peaceful and reflective experience!

St. Paul's Cathedral in Kolkata is a majestic symbol of Indo-Gothic architecture and colonial heritage. Completed in 1847, it was the first Anglican cathedral built in Asia and remains the seat of the Diocese of Calcutta. Designed by Major William Nairn Forbes and architect C.K. Robinson, its towering spire, pointed arches, and stained-glass windows reflect a blend of Gothic Revival and Indian adaptations suited to the local climate. Located on Cathedral Road near Victoria Memorial and Birla Planetarium, the cathedral is surrounded by lush gardens and offers a serene retreat from the city's bustle. Inside, visitors find a high-vaulted nave, intricate woodwork, and frescoes depicting the life of St. Paul.

An architectural masterpiece!
Visiting St. Paul's Cathedral was an unforgettable experience. The grandeur of the dome, the intricate details in the interior, and the peaceful ambiance make it truly breathtaking. The Whispering Gallery is a unique highlight, and the panoramic view from the top is worth every step. The staff were warm and welcoming, and the entire place is well-maintained. Highly recommend booking tickets in advance to make the entry smooth and hassle-free. A must-visit for history, architecture, and photography lovers!

As the sun begins to dip behind the treetops, Rabindra Sarovar transforms into something magical. The golden light reflects off the still waters of the lake, painting the entire scene in warm hues of orange and pink. Birds return to their nests, their silhouettes dancing across the sky, while some glide just above the water, creating ripples in the calm surface.

Families stroll along the tree-lined paths, some laughing, some simply soaking in the quiet. Children play near the benches, and couples find quiet corners to sit and talk. Occasionally, you'll spot kayakers gently paddling across the lake, their boats cutting through the sunset's reflection like brushstrokes on a canvas.

It's not just a park-it's a breath of fresh air, a reminder of how beautiful moments can still exist in the heart of a busy city. Whether you're here for a peaceful walk, to take photos, or to simply sit and watch nature do its thing, evenings at Rabindra Sarovar offer a rare kind of calm that stays with you long after you leave.

places.name: Nicco park

reviews.text:
Nicco Park in Kolkata is a popular amusement park that offers a fun-filled experience for visitors of all ages. Here's what you can expect:

Variety of Rides : Nicco Park has 48 rides and attractions, including roller coasters, water rides, and virtual reality experiences.
Family-Friendly : The park is ideal for spending quality time with family and kids, with many attractions suitable for all ages.
Cleanliness and Maintenance : The park is generally well-maintained, with a focus on cleanliness and safety.

Must-Try Attractions:

River Cave: A fun ride that's perfect for families and kids.
Skydiver: A recent addition to the park that's gained popularity among visitors.

Overall, Nicco Park is a great destination for families and thrill-seekers, offering a fun-filled experience with a range of rides and attractions.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Nicco Park is without a doubt one of the best attractions in Kolkata for a fun-filled day with family and friends. From the moment you step inside, you're greeted with a lively atmosphere, lush greenery, and well-organized pathways that make the entire park easy to explore. It truly lives up to its nickname - the "Disneyland of the East."

The variety of rides here is impressive. Whether you're an adventure seeker who loves high-speed roller coasters and the Cyclone ride, or someone who prefers calmer experiences like the cable car or toy train, there's something for everyone. The park maintains high safety standards, and you can see staff actively ensuring that rides are operated smoothly and securely.

The Water Park section is a highlight in itself - perfect for cooling off on a warm day. The wave pool, water slides, and lazy river are all well-maintained and super fun. Kids absolutely love the splash zones, and adults can enjoy the slides just as much.

Another great thing about Nicco Park is the cleanliness. You'll find dustbins at regular intervals, and the staff are quick to keep the area neat. There are also plenty of food stalls offering everything from snacks to full meals, with both local and international options. The prices are reasonable for the quality and convenience.

It's not just about rides - Nicco Park also has beautiful gardens, a small aquarium, and various fun activities that make it more than just an amusement park. You can easily spend an entire day here without feeling bored.

Overall, Nicco Park offers excellent value for money and delivers an experience that's enjoyable for people of all ages. It's a must-visit in Kolkata if you're looking for adventure, entertainment, and a bit of nostalgia all in one place.

Nicco Park is a great place for a fun-filled day with family and friends. It offers a wide variety of rides and attractions, especially for kids and young adults. The main amusement park has some exciting rides and scenic spots, and the water park is definitely a highlight, especially during the summer.

However, it can get very crowded on weekends, especially in the water park section. Be prepared for long queues for most of the popular rides. If you're planning a visit, weekdays might be a better option for a more relaxed experience.

The food at the caf√© inside was surprisingly good-fresh and tasty with decent options for both snacks and meals. One thing to note is that basic items like bottled water are sold at a premium-a 1-liter bottle costs ‚Çπ50, which feels a bit overpriced.

Overall, Nicco Park offers a memorable day out, especially for families, but planning ahead and visiting on a less busy day can make a big difference.

places.generalDescription: South Park Street Cemetery, an 18th-century Christian graveyard in Kolkata, is known for its large and picturesque tombstones. It is home to the final resting places of notable figures such as Walter Landor Dickens, Captain Edward Cooke, and Maj General Charles Stuart. The cemetery also features Grave 363, famous for its epitaph that reads 'A virtuous mother.'

sources.snippet: The Park Street Cemetery was one of the earliest non-church cemeteries in the world, and probably the largest Christian cemetery outside Europe and America in the 19th century. Opened in 1767 on what was previously a marshy area, the cemetery was in use until about 1830 and is now a heritage site, protected by the Archaeological Survey of India. The tombs are a mix of Gothic and the rich flavor of the Indo-Saracenic style.

reviews.text:
üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü (5/5)

A Slice of Peace in the Heart of Kolkata

Princep Ghat is truly one of Kolkata's most iconic and peaceful spots. The view of the Hooghly River, especially during sunset, is breathtaking. Whether you're on a casual walk, enjoying a boat ride, or simply sitting by the riverside, the atmosphere is calm and refreshing. The white Palladian-style monument is beautifully maintained and adds a historical charm.

Evenings are vibrant with street food vendors, local musicians, and couples strolling hand in hand. It's a perfect blend of nature, history, and local life. The surrounding gardens are clean, and the nearby railway station makes it easily accessible.

Highly recommend visiting if you're in Kolkata - don't forget your camera, the views are picture-perfect!
Good place to visit for a boat ride in evenings for sunsets. You can also walk here in the garden areas and enjoy the scenic view of river Ganga.

Princep Ghat is one of Kolkata's most iconic landmarks and a must-visit destination for both locals and tourists. Located along the banks of the Hooghly River, it beautifully combines history, architecture, and natural beauty. Built in 1843 in memory of the British scholar James Prinsep, the structure boasts stunning colonial-style design and is surrounded by lush green gardens, making it an ideal spot for relaxation and photography. The place is especially charming during the evenings when the Vidyasagar Setu, which looms majestically overhead, is lit up, creating a magical atmosphere.

Visitors can enjoy peaceful walks along the riverbank, take a boat ride for a mesmerizing view of the sunset, or simply sit and watch the gentle flow of the Hooghly. Street food stalls nearby offer delicious local snacks, adding to the experience. It's also a favorite spot for couples, families, and photographers due to its scenic charm. The area is well-maintained, with clean surroundings and proper seating arrangements.

Reaching Princep Ghat is easy, as it is well-connected by road and even has a nearby railway station. Early mornings and evenings are the best times to visit, as you can witness the golden hues of sunrise or sunset reflecting on the water. Whether you're looking for a peaceful escape, a place to unwind, or a spot to soak in Kolkata's heritage, Princep Ghat offers it all. Highly recommended for a serene and memorable experience in the city.

National Cultural Association established the Museum in 1972 on Panditji's name on his birthday. Today when a child walks into Nehru Children's Museum, he walks into a world of treasure. It touches the imaginative mind and encourages him to know more. The exhibits in the museum which are spread over 4 floors, enable a child to take off to the world of epics, the world of science and to dream.

Dolls gallery, Toys gallery, Ramayana & Mahabharata in clay models are the most fascinating archives for the children.

The Museum remains open for all between 11 am and 6 pm on Wednesday through Sunday. The Museum remains closed for the public on Mondays and Tuesdays.

Very nice place for kids. Kids can join plenty of activities like wall painting, canvas painting, robotics, music etc. there is excellent ramayan story depicted in photos. Highly recommend

Given above are the images of a robotic activity. Centrally located. Nearest metro station is Rabindra sadan. (2 minutes walk)

A heaven of dolls and figurines. A museum solely based on dolls is itself quite interesting. Dolls and figurines of all kinds (so many variations) are exhibited here along with the history and stories behind them. An impressive collection of dolls of different countries as well as India. Innumerable amount of figurines of different shape, size, colour, style, clothes claims appreciation and reverence for the artists. Getting tired by seeing so many dolls are natural. Ticket price is different for adults and kids.

places.address: Nehru children's museum, 94/1, Jawaharlal Nehru Rd, Maidan, Kolkata, West Bengal 700020, India

places.generalDescription: AltAir - Capella is a rooftop restaurant located on the 20th floor of AltAir Boutique Hotel in Kolkata, offering stunning panoramic views of the city. The venue features a restobar-kitchen-brewery-skybar concept with gourmet plated delights, live entertainment, and a full bar serving sumptuous cocktail snack options. Additionally, Rendezvous, an upscale French cafe at Altair, combines Haute French cuisine with Pondicherry influences for a unique dining experience.

sources.snippet: Yes, we are a little biased towards rooftop seating, and why shouldn‚Äôt we be?. After all, there‚Äôs nothing better than relishing your dinner under the canopy of stars, with your significant other right by your side.
sources.shortName: The Best Romantic Restaurants In Kolkata That Are Perfect For A Dreamy Date

places.name: AltAir - Capella

reviews.text:
This is one of the few experiences that will stay with you forever. Right from the beginning we are awestruck by the interiors of the place. Every corner was picture worthy!!

So I won't dare to say anything bad about this place. Love it so much!!

Coming to the food we thought that the wait time was a bit too long though it might have been due to the high demand as we went on 1st January this year.

Food quality wise this was great and tasty too.

Finally I would love to come back here again and again.

I recently visited AltAir - Capella and had a mixed experience. The food was just okay, nothing particularly impressive or memorable.

However, the view from the restaurant was absolutely stunning! It's definitely a great spot to enjoy a meal with a beautiful backdrop.

Unfortunately, the ambience didn't quite live up to my expectations. The music was too loud and didn't seem to match the atmosphere of the restaurant. It felt a bit disjointed and took away from my overall experience.

Overall, I would recommend AltAir - Capella for its amazing view, but perhaps not for its food or ambience. Maybe they can work on improving those aspects to make it a more well-rounded experience.
Their restaurant is full of tasty food with lesser options on the menu. I really liked the ambience and the staff are very cordial and polite. The pool side view was worth it.

places.address: Ambuja Neotia EcoCentre, 20th Floor, EM-4, Street No. 13, EM Block, Sector V, Bidhannagar, Kolkata, West Bengal 700091, India

places.generalDescription: This stylish Thai restaurant in The Oberoi Grand is  decorated with native motifs & carved wood.

sources.snippet: Finally, there‚Äôs Baan Thai, a name that most Kolkatans are familiar with, all thanks to the delicious Thai fare offered out here. And while most of us absolutely dig their Thai curries and delicious seafood, did you know that it is also a great spot for a romantic dinner?. After all, keeping aside the mouth-watering concoctions, the ambience of this place is incredibly vibrant, and a total treat for the eyes.
sources.shortName: The Best Romantic Restaurants In Kolkata That Are Perfect For A Dreamy Date

places.name: Baan Thai

reviews.text: Incredible service from the whole team. I had private authentic floor seating. A candle. And a server that brought me extra spicy sauce, dished my food on my plate, and even gave me a complimentary dessert. It was a bit pricey, but the service, quality of food, and ambience were worth it! Sabita and Tenzing were amazing!!

Baan Thai at Grand Oberoi Kolkata is a delightful Thai restaurant that offers an authentic taste of Thailand right in the heart of the city. The cozy ambiance, attentive service, and exquisite flavors make it a must-visit for Thai food enthusiasts. From traditional Pad Thai to flavorful curries, each dish is prepared with precision and care, ensuring a memorable dining experience. Don't miss the opportunity to indulge in their delicious offerings and transport your taste buds to the vibrant streets of Thailand

Good Thai foods in town. However you might not get authentic taste of Thai food here. Prices are a bit high comparing to the portion n quality you will get.
Recommend for foreigners who never tried Thai food before.

places.address: The, OBEROI GRAND KOLKATA, 15, Jawaharlal Nehru Rd, Esplanade, Dharmatala, Taltala, Kolkata, West Bengal 700013, India

This will bring out your partner's gaming spirit and you can have fun challenging them to a game of bowling pins.

places.name: Nicco Super Bowl

reviews.text:
Spent an epic day at Nicco Super Bowl with the gang, and honestly, it was just what we needed. After downing a few chilled beers, the energy hit different ‚Äì every throw felt like a celebration, every strike was a victory dance, and even the gutter balls had us in splits.

The place has a vibrant and energetic atmosphere ‚Äì neon lights, great music, and a vibe that just screams fun. The lanes were smooth, the arcade games kept us pumped between rounds, and the staff was super chill and helpful.

Bowling with a buzz made it even more hilarious ‚Äì from wild celebrations to competitive banter, the whole experience was pure gold. And the nearby food options made sure our beer-fueled hunger was taken care of.

If you're looking to kick back, laugh loud, and make some unforgettable memories with friends, Nicco Super Bowl is the perfect strike zone. 10/10, would roll again. üç∫üé≥üî•

I recently visited this bowling alley and had a great time with friends. The lanes are well-maintained, and the equipment is in good condition. The overall atmosphere is lively, making it an excellent place for group outings or casual fun. The staff were friendly and attentive, ensuring everything ran smoothly. While the place can get a bit crowded during peak hours, it adds to the energy. They also offer a decent selection of snacks and drinks. Overall, a fun and enjoyable experience, and I look forward to visiting again.

Nicco Super Bowl is a fantastic spot to unwind with a variety of gaming options. From bowling to air hockey, basketball, pool, and car racing video games, there's something fun for everyone. The venue is well-maintained, with the bowling lanes being particularly impressive and in excellent condition. What really stands out, however, is how budget-friendly the charges are, making it an affordable choice for a day out.

Here's a breakdown of the pricing: The entry fee is just ‚Çπ100 per person. Bowling is only ‚Çπ150 for a 10-round game, and it's shareable, so you can easily split the cost with friends. Other games like air hockey and basketball are priced at ‚Çπ60 for 3 minutes, while the pool table is available for ‚Çπ80 per 15 minutes.

With such reasonable prices, Nicco Super Bowl offers great entertainment without breaking the bank. Whether you're in the mood for a friendly bowling match or some competitive gaming, this venue has got you covered!

places.address: near NICCO PARK, Jheel Meel, Sector IV, Bidhannagar, Kolkata, West Bengal 700106, India

places.generalDescription: Afraa Lounge is a luxurious dining destination in Kolkata, offering a diverse range of Mediterranean, Asian, and Indian cuisine. The restaurant boasts lavish decor with artwork and plush furnishings, creating a warm and romantic ambiance perfect for special occasions. Located on the rooftop of Salt Lake City Centre 1, it provides stunning views from one of the highest points in the mall. Guests can indulge in buffet dining experiences by making prior reservations to ensure an unforgettable culinary journey.

sources.snippet: Talking of the experience of buffet dining in Kolkata, there is no better place than Afraa Restaurant and Lounge. Though a joint that cannot be visited without prior booking, this place definitely does justice to the effort. Treat your special someone to the luxury of this spectacular restaurant and make them realize the place that they hold in your life.
sources.shortName: 23 Places To Visit In Kolkata For Couples, Places For Couples In Kolkata

places.name: Afraa Lounge

reviews.text:
Visited this lounge on Saturday evening with my family. We ordered a variety of dishes, starting with appetizers, moving on to a bit of the main course, and ending with some delicious desserts. Everything was served with great care and presentation.

The staffs were exceptionally pleasant, amiable, and attentive. They recommended their special dishes based on our preferences. Since some of my family members are seniors, the staff took time to engage with them, understand their tastes, and make suitable suggestions accordingly.

The ambiance of the lounge was unique-slightly dim, as is typical for such places-but upon our request, they brightened the space a bit so we could take some photos. Since we were with children, the staff made adjustments to ensure a comfortable and family-friendly atmosphere.

We also ordered a gin cocktail and a few mocktails, all of which were expertly crafted and incredibly flavorful. We ended up staying longer than expected as some of our relatives arrived late, but the staff remained kind, patient, and cooperative throughout.

Overall, it was a wonderful experience-from the food and drinks to the ambiance and hospitality. Highly recommended!

If you want to have an amazing fine dining experience at saltlake area then Afraa lounge would be one of the best choices for you. It is located at the 6th floor of CC1 mall. Great ambiance, professional staff , delicious food . We celebrated birthday party there with few numbers of teenagers and the staffs were very cooperative and careful about them. Had a great experience over there.

Food was too good and so was the service. What I did not liked was their table which was quite low. Probably the one were I sat.

I would like to return back to try their continental dishes since the Indian dishes we tried were all mouth watering and finger licking.

A bit overpriced.

places.address: 6th Floor, City Centre Mall, G-Block, Sector 1, Bidhannagar, Kolkata, West Bengal 700064, India

places.generalDescription: World flavours combine on the menu of this atmospheric hotel restaurant.

sources.snippet: Being in the lone company of your loved one, having some of best views of the city with the best food that the city has to offer, the concept does seem like the planning of a perfect date. Treat yourself to the same when you make a visit to the Tamara restaurant. Known for its astounding ambiance and plush setting, this place is perfect for a romantic dinner.
sources.shortName: 23 Places To Visit In Kolkata For Couples, Places For Couples In Kolkata

places.name: Tamara

reviews.text: A very elaborate menu but also very tasty. I had both breakfast and lunch here and they knocked it out of the park. I had Hilsa and home styled chicken. Fantastic dishes both.  The quality and quantity are both top notch. They also serve a nice chocolate pan at the end. The chicken was the stand out for me. Hilsa was authentic too.

If you're a foodie like me, you'll love this place! The menu has a fantastic selection of dishes, and it was a buffet during festive season, we went on saptami evening with friends and families. We loved everything we tried. The menu offers a wide variety of options, and everything we tried was delicious. We only had good comments about the food and services. Ambiances was giving a good vibes. Recommended.

Nice ambience, decoration and food quality. We tried Murg Tikka Peshawari (‚Çπ495) which was very good, chickens were juicy and tasty. Lighting is romantic and candles provided in each table. Must go in evening rather in day time because of ambience. Good for both couples and family. Price is costly.

places.address: Pipal Tree Hotel, AS/464, Hatiara,Major Arterial Road, Noapara, Sukanta Pally, Rajarhat, West Bengal 700157, India

places.generalDescription: This swanky open-air lounge on the roof of The Lindsay serves cocktails & a range of global dishes.

sources.snippet: The way to a man heart is through his stomach and the statement surely holds true when talking of the place called Blue And Beyond. This little joint is known best for its luxuriousness, which is clearly visible in everything from its ambiance to its menu. With the chance to taste the food from different cuisines to the rooftop panoramic views of the city, this place has the perfect recipe for you to charm your way into your date‚Äôs heart.
sources.shortName: 23 Places To Visit In Kolkata For Couples, Places For Couples In Kolkata

sources.snippet: Blue and Beyond Restaurant in Located in Lindsay Hotel and is a fine dining multi-cuisine restaurant, Kolkata‚Äôs only venue with a view from the roof top, serves wide selection of mesmerizing dishes and refreshing drinks.
sources.shortName: 14 Best Romantic Places in Kolkata For Couples

places.name: Blue & Beyond Rooftop RestoBar

reviews.text:
Went on my anniversary, it was really a great experience for both of us. Ambience was breezy and delightful. Ordered half tandoori chicken, hot garlic chicken, butter nan and jeera rice. Loved all there dishes specially the starter and jeera rice. Staffs were friendly and delivered the food on time.

Vantage point is that you can get a 180 degree view of kolkata from their rooftop seating arrangement.

Blue and Beyond is a popular rooftop restaurant located in the heart of Kolkata's New Market area. Known for its chic ambiance and panoramic views of the city skyline, it offers a perfect blend of fine dining and a relaxing atmosphere.
One of the major attractions of Blue and Beyond is its stunning rooftop setting. The open-air seating offers a beautiful view of the bustling city below, especially at night when the skyline is lit up. The serene, elevated location provides a refreshing escape from the chaos of the city, making it ideal for a romantic dinner or a relaxed evening with friends.

Apart from the ambience every thing was just average . Food could not justify the prices and so was the bad service . Their menu is restricted to just few options not much .
We ordered :
Hot N sour chicken soup  - 165/-  for full
Paneer tikka just 4 medium sized pieces for 275/-
Tangdi Kebab - 3 piece for 385/-
orange blossom Mocktail which was white in color for 225/-
And Kung Pao chicken Sizzler  for 425/-

Only the soup was in ample quantity sufficient for 2 people rest everything had a small portion . There was nothing extra ordinary about the Tangdi kebab and paneer tikka, just like some road side stall . Sizzler was OKAY , too much of sauce confusing ones palette .

Overall it could be good for just one time visit that too if you are not a foodiee...

We asked the waiter to bring the soup and Paneer tikka first and then the other ones Later . But the waiter bought the Mocktail too with the hot items and soup .  Just then even after clear requests he bought the Sizzler within minutes before we could even finish the soup .
Please return back the food if they do so because sitting outside makes your waiting food cold and dusty .

The worst part is they are leveraging 18% GST on your bill which even some of the most renowned restaurants don't.

We booked through EazyDiner app so we got a good discount .

Overall just an OKAY experience .

places.address: 8A & 8B, Lindsay Street, Lindsay Hotel, Opp, New Market Area, Kolkata, West Bengal 700087, India

places.generalDescription: Glook The Sky Lounge is a stylish indoor-outdoor rooftop venue in Kolkata, offering regional dishes and drinks in a chic setting. It's popular for romantic evenings due to its open-air ambiance and stunning views, especially at night. The lounge features lavish interior design and provides breathtaking vistas of the city. With various indoor and outdoor seating options, it's an ideal spot for a romantic date or special celebration.

sources.snippet: Next, our hunt for the best romantic restaurants in Kolkata took us to Glook - The Sky Lounge, which is yet another excellent open-air venue, perfect for a date night. First things first, its rooftop setting is super-romantic, especially during evenings. Not to mention, the majestic view it offers is a sight to behold.
sources.shortName: The Best Romantic Restaurants In Kolkata That Are Perfect For A Dreamy Date

places.name: Glook The Sky Lounge

reviews.text:
One of the best place in newtown to vibe on with friends or colleague or loved ones. Great ambiance and food is great with good music. They have a dance floor. In their sky lounge you get a amazing view of new town.
And the behaviour of the staffs are nice and polite.

Very well located and a nice place, but the rooftop area being closed for now half the charm of the place is  gone. Also on the day of our visit the main restaurant area was fully reserved so we were seated in a dimly lit claustrophobic area. So better to call and confirm about seating area before visiting. The starter items were very good also north Indian items. Biriyani was a disaster. Some cocktails were very good, some average. So a mixed experience this time. Special mention ..all the staff, very well behaved and friendly

Glook The Sky Lounge is a fantastic spot in Kolkata, offering a unique blend of Indian and continental cuisine. Located on the 5th floor of The Terminus in Newtown, this rooftop cafe provides breathtaking views of the city skyline.

The ambiance is modern and chic, with comfortable seating arrangements perfect for a romantic dinner or a night out with friends. They also have outdoor seating, takeaway, and delivery options available.

Their menu features a variety of dishes, including Chinese, North Indian, and Continental cuisine. Some popular items include Spaghetti Aglio E Olio, Mocktail, Fish, Chicken Afghani Tandoori, and Ravioli.

Glook The Sky Lounge also boasts a well-stocked bar with an impressive selection of cocktails, soft drinks, and wines. They have live music performances and DJs, making it an excellent spot for celebrations.

In terms of pricing, the average cost for two people is around ‚Çπ2,900, with a pint of beer costing ‚Çπ300 . They also have banquet halls available for events, with a capacity of 250 seats and 350 floating guests.

Overall, Glook The Sky Lounge is a great spot to enjoy delicious food, stunning views, and a lively atmosphere.üíû
